intro: Galium parisiense, commonly known as wood sorrel, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive waxy coating. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in early spring. Galium parisiense is native to Europe and is often found in woodland and grassy areas.
